Record.ClassificationPath: Hemic and Lymphatic Diseases/Hematologic Diseases/Blood Group Incompatibility
Record.Description: A mismatch between donor and recipient blood. Antibodies present in the recipient's serum are directed against antigens in the donor product. Such a mismatch may result in a transfusion reaction in which, for example, donor blood is hemolyzed. (From Saunders Dictionary & Encyclopedia of Laboratory Medicine and Technology, 1984)
